content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 6 to node 10 is:

6 -> 13 -> 7 -> 8 -> 10

Note that this is the shortest path in the provided graph, and if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path would be:

10 -> 8 -> 7 -> 13 -> 6

This is because the original graph provided has the starting point (node 6) as a destination for two edges (to nodes 11 and 13), so this can only be a problem if you have an unidirectional graph or there are two paths that meet at node 6. In any case, I've included both options here for you to check with your question provider.

The shortest path from node 10 to node 6 is:

10 -> 5 -> 8 -> 6

Note that this is the shortest path in the provided graph, and if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path would be:

6 -> 2 -> 13 -> 7 -> 10

This is because the original graph provided has the starting point (node 10) as a destination for two edges (to nodes 13 and 5), so this can only be a problem if you have an unidirectional graph or there are two paths that meet at node 10. In any case, I've included both options here for you to check with your question provider.
